title: Deutsche Craigs kicks off Serko raising, selldown
text:
Travel and expenses software company Serko is cap in hand in front of fund managers on Thursday.

Serko, which is listed on the ASX and NZX, is seeking to raise $NZ40 million in a placement at $NZ4.04 a share.

The placement was accompanied by a $NZ16 million selldown by directors and employees including chairman Simon Betherway and CEO Darrin Grafton.

Serko CEO Darrin Grafton is reducing his stake in the company as part of a wider equity raising on Thursday. John Nicholson

The deal was also to be followed by a share purchase plan worth up to another $NZ5 million.

The price was at a 4.9 per cent premium to the last close, according to terms sent to fund managers on Thursday morning, and a 0.8 per cent discount to the 30 day VWAP.
